data.title: New York inmates will be able to view total solar eclipse after lawsuit settled with corrections department
data.description: Six New York inmates will be able to see the total solar eclipse after reaching a settlement with the corrections department following a lawsuit claiming violation of religious rights.

data.title: Latino voters may make or break the presidential election in swing states like Nevada
data.description: The latest numbers show the majority of Latino voters in Nevada are registered as non-partisan and make up a key group candidates need to win over.

data.title: Alabama man found with Easter eggs containing nearly 200 fentanyl pills, synthetic cannabis: police
data.description: Alabama authorities caught a man red-handed when they found fentanyl pills alongside synthetic cannabis stashed inside Easter eggs located inside the 29-year-old's car.

data.title: GREG GUTFELD: 'Diversity, equity & inclusion' has done it again
data.description: "Gutfeld!" host Greg Gutfeld decries Seattle Public Schools for discontinuing its program for gifted students.

data.title: SEAN HANNITY: RFK, Jr.'s a 'devout, radical environmentalist'
data.description: Fox News host Sean Hannity highlights several positions Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. supports on "Hannity."

data.title: Emmanuel Acho responds to critics who 'respectfully reprimanded' him over his Angel Reese comments
data.description: Former NFL player and current sports TV analyst Emmanuel Acho is under fire after he appeared to defend some of the criticism directed at LSU star Angel Reese.

data.title: Oklahoma mom who executed 2 kids, injured another with gunshots to the head â€˜as they slept' learns fate
data.description: An Oklahoma mother was sentenced to life in prison after she shot and killed two of her teenagers while they were sleeping in 2018.

data.title: Indian child sex offender arrested after Maryland courts give light sentences, detainer holds ignored: ICE
data.description: An Indian citizen convicted of child sex offenses in Maryland was arrested by immigration authorities near his home last month and was order to be deported.

data.title: Former college football coach Scott Frost 'dying' for second chance: 'I don't know what's next'
data.description: Despite being the hottest name in college football coaching circles at one time, Scott Frost hasn't found a new job since his time on the sideline came to an abrupt halt in 2022.

data.title: JESSE WATTERS: Biden's economic boom is not for Americans, but for illegal immigrants
data.description: "Jesse Watters Primetime" host Jesse Watters claims President Biden has created 5 million migrant jobs amid the president's touting his administration's economic success.

data.title: PGA Tour star Jordan Spieth dazzles with hole-in-one at Valero Texas Open
data.description: Jordan Spieth hit the perfect tee shot on hole 16 of his opening round at the Valero Texas Open, dropping the ball in for a hole-in-one, the third of his career.

data.title: LAURA INGRAHAM: Trans-infiltration of women's sports put women in actual danger
data.description: Fox News host Laura Ingraham unpacks the 'war against women' on 'The Ingraham Angle.'

data.title: Human leg discovered in Wisconsin park, police investigating as homicide
data.description: Deputies are investigating what they are calling a "suspicious death" after a human leg was discovered inside a Milwaukee area park on April 2.

data.title: Madonna fires back at concert lawsuit, claims 'no Madonna fan' would expect her to take stage at ticketed time
data.description: Madonna is seeking to dismiss a lawsuit that alleges fans were deceived by the Material Girl when she took the stage two hours late at a Brooklyn concert.

data.title: Illegal immigrant in Illinois accused of nearly decapitating his wife in front of their two children
data.description: An illegal immigrant that just crossed into the U.S. from Mexico about two weeks ago, is accused of viciously stabbing his wife to death in front of their two young children.

data.title: Bombing kills co-founder of Syria's main al-Qaida-linked group, once known as Nusra Front
data.description: Abu Maria al-Qahtani, the co-founder of Syria's main al-Qaida-linked group, was killed Thursday by a suicide bomber in the northwestern part of the country, according to a war monitor.

data.title: No Labels declines to field candidate in 2024 presidential sweeps: 'A hero never emerged'
data.description: No Labels, the group once led by the late Sen. Joe Lieberman, I-Conn., decided against fielding a candidate in the 2024 presidential sweeps.

data.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's red line on Speaker Johnson
data.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene is already looking to dump House Speaker Mike Johnson, less then a year after an incredibly messy speaker election

data.title: Adams touts NYC's ability to 'manage' migrant crisis, offers Abbott free stay at shelter during trip
data.description: NYC Mayor Eric Adams said he hopes Texas Gov. Greg Abbott will see how well his administration has managed the migrant crisis in the Big Apple during his trip to Manhattan.

data.title: Massachusetts man, recipient of first successful pig kidney transplant, is discharged from hospital
data.description: The first person to receive a genetically modified pig kidney transplant has been discharged from Massachusetts General Hospital, the hospital announced on Wednesday.
